{"step_by_step_thinking": "The commissures of the brain are structures that connect the two hemispheres. The Commissure of Ganser and the Commissure of Gudden are relatively small structures. The Corpus Callosum, on the other hand, is the largest commissure in the brain, connecting the left and right cerebral hemispheres and facilitating interhemispheric communication.", "answer_choice": "C. Corpus callosum"}
